title: How to Make a DIY Galaxy Jar

steps.headline: Firstly, you will need to make four galaxy colours to do this use these combinations of the food colouring:- 2 drops of blue = dark blue- 1 drop of blue = light blue- 2 green and 1 blue = greenish/blue- 2 drops blue, 2 drops green = aqua
Stir it all together and then let it sit for 1 minute.
steps.description: Make sure to do this outside so that it does not get warm otherwise the colours will fade.

steps.headline: Get your jar, water colours, cotton balls, and glitter/stars.
Place a few cotton balls on the bottom of the jar until it covers the surface.
Sprinkle some stars and glitter around it and then add the water mix.
Keep layering the cotton until it reaches the top.
steps.description: Adding a different water colour every layer.

steps.headline: Get some blackboard paint and paint the lid.
Next grab your left over glitter and sprinkle it on the boarder of the lid on the wet paint like a boarder
Write what you like!
steps.description: It can be anything from "Happy Birthday!" to "Merry Christmas!"

text: Making the colours Firstly, you will need to make four galaxy colours to do this use these combinations of the food colouring:- 2 drops of blue = dark blue- 1 drop of blue = light blue- 2 green and 1 blue = greenish/blue- 2 drops blue, 2 drops green = aqua  Stir it all together and then let it sit for 1 minute. Make sure to do this outside so that it does not get warm otherwise the colours will fade. Making The Galaxy Get your jar, water colours, cotton balls, and glitter/stars.  Place a few cotton balls on the bottom of the jar until it covers the surface.  Sprinkle some stars and glitter around it and then add the water mix.  Keep layering the cotton until it reaches the top. Adding a different water colour every layer. Decorations Get some blackboard paint and paint the lid.  Next grab your left over glitter and sprinkle it on the boarder of the lid on the wet paint like a boarder  Write what you like! It can be anything from "Happy Birthday!" to "Merry Christmas!" Finished.
sentences: Making the colours Firstly, you will need to make four galaxy colours to do this use these combinations of the food colouring:- 2 drops of blue = dark blue- 1 drop of blue = light blue- 2 green and 1 blue = greenish/blue- 2 drops blue, 2 drops green = aqua  Stir it all together and then let it sit for 1 minute.
Make sure to do this outside so that it does not get warm otherwise the colours will fade.
Making The Galaxy Get your jar, water colours, cotton balls, and glitter/stars.
Place a few cotton balls on the bottom of the jar until it covers the surface.
Sprinkle some stars and glitter around it and then add the water mix.
Keep layering the cotton until it reaches the top.
Adding a different water colour every layer.
Decorations Get some blackboard paint and paint the lid.
Next grab your left over glitter and sprinkle it on the boarder of the lid on the wet paint like a boarder  Write what you like!
It can be anything from "Happy Birthday!"
tyn_section: 1 drop of blue, and green food colouring
